Package ohos.wifi

Class WifiDeviceConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.wifi.WifiDeviceConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sequenceable

    public final class WifiDeviceConfig
extends Object
implements Sequenceable
    Provides the configuration of a Wi-Fi access point.

    Using this to connect to a Wi-Fi access point with specified configuration, including the SSID, encryption mode, and password.

    Since:
    5

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface ohos.utils.Sequenceable

      • getSsid

        public String getSsid​()
        Obtains the SSID in the Wi-Fi configuration.

        The SSID is in UTF-8 format.

        Returns:
        Returns the SSID.
        Since:
        5

      • setSsid

        public void setSsid​(String ssid)
        Sets the SSID name of a Wi-Fi access point.

        The SSID must be in UTF-8 format and can contain a maximum of 32 characters.

        Parameters:
        ssid - Indicates the SSID name to be set.
        Since:
        5

      • getBssid

        public String getBssid​()
        Obtains the BSSID in the Wi-Fi configuration.

        The BSSID is in XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX format.

        Returns:
        Returns the BSSID; returns null if BSSID is not configured.
        Since:
        5

      • getPreSharedKey

        public String getPreSharedKey​()
        Obtains the password in the Wi-Fi configuration.

        If PSK encryption is used, a password is mandatory.

        Returns:
        Returns the password; returns null if no password is configured.
        Since:
        5

      • setPreSharedKey

        public void setPreSharedKey​(String preSharedKey)
        Sets the password of a Wi-Fi access point.

        If the PSK encryption mode is used, a password is mandatory.

        Note: The password can only contain ASCII characters.

        Parameters:
        preSharedKey - Indicates the password of the Wi-Fi access point.
        Since:
        5

      • isHiddenSsid

        public boolean isHiddenSsid​()
        Checks whether the Wi-Fi access point broadcasts the SSID.

        During a Wi-Fi scanning, the SSID of a Wi-Fi access point that is not hidden is contained in the request frame.

        Returns:
        Returns true if a hidden SSID is configured; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        5

      • setHiddenSsid

        public void setHiddenSsid​(boolean isHiddenSsid)
        Hides an SSID for a Wi-Fi access point.
        Parameters:
        isHiddenSsid - Specifies whether to hide the SSID. The value true indicates that the SSID is hidden, and the value false indicates that the SSID is not hidden.
        Since:
        5

      • getSecurityType

        public int getSecurityType​()
        Obtains the encryption mode in the Wi-Fi configuration.

        An example encryption mode is WifiSecurity#PSK.

        Returns:
        Returns the encryption mode.
        Since:
        5
        See Also:
        WifiSecurity.PSK

      • setSecurityType

        public void setSecurityType​(int securityType)
        Sets the encryption mode of a Wi-Fi access point.

        If the PSK encryption mode is used, a password must be set using setPreSharedKey(java.lang.String).

        Parameters:
        securityType - Indicates the encryption mode to be set, such as WifiSecurity#PSK.
        Since:
        5
        See Also:
        WifiSecurity.PSK

      • isRestricted

        public boolean isRestricted​()
        Checks whether the data volume is not restricted in this network.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the data volume is not restricted in this network; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        5

      • setRestricted

        public void setRestricted​(boolean isDataRestricted)
        Sets whether to restrict the data volume in this network.
        Parameters:
        isDataRestricted - Specifies whether to restrict the data volume in this network. The value true indicates that the data volume is restricted, and value false indicates that the data volume is not restricted.
        Since:
        5
